remarks: The Taylor polynomial is a polynomial of degree (at most) ` N ` . This version of ~ taylply shows that the coefficients of ` T ` are in a subring of the complex numbers.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jan-2017.)
statement:
taylpfval.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
taylpfval.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
taylpfval.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ S ) $.
taylpfval.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
taylpfval.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. dom ( ( S Dn F ) ` N ) ) $.
taylpfval.t $e |- T = ( N ( S Tayl F ) B ) $.
taylply2.1 $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( SubRing ` CCfld ) ) $.
taylply2.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. D ) $.
taylply2.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( 0 ... N ) ) -> ( ( ( ( S Dn F ) ` k ) ` B ) / ( ! ` k ) ) e. D ) $.
taylply2 $p |- ( ph -> ( T e. ( Poly ` D ) /\ ( deg ` T ) <_ N ) ) $.
$d B k $.
$d D k $.
$d F k $.
$d N k $.
$d S k $.
$d k ph $.
